statement.tex: \text{The postmaster of a local office wishes to}\\ \text{hire extra helpers during the festive season}\\ \text{because of a large increase in the volume of}\\ \text{mail handling and delivery. Because of the}\\ \text{limited office space and budgetary constraints,}\\ \text{the number of temporary helpers cannot exceed}\\ \text{10. According to past experience, a man can}\\ \text{handle 300 letters and 80 packets per day, on}\\ \text{the average, and a woman can handle 400}\\ \text{letters and 50 packets per day. The postmaster}\\ \text{believes that the daily volume of extra mail}\\ \text{and packets will be no less than 3400 and 680}\\ \text{respectively. A man receives Rs. 225 a day}\\ \text{and a woman receives Rs. 200 a day.}\\ \text{How many men and women should be hired to}\\ \text{keep the pay-roll at a minimum? Formulate}\\ \text{an LPP and solve it graphically.}

step.context: \text{Let } m =\text{ number of men hired and}\\ w = \text{number of women hired. Given this,}\\ \text{does the table below correctly capture the}\\ \text{constraints the postmaster faces?}
step.tex: \begin{tabular}{|c|c|} \hline \text{Constraint} & \text{Line to plot} \\ \hline m\geq 0, w\geq 0 & m = 0, w = 0 \\ \hline m + w \leq 10 & w = 10 - m \\ \hline 300m + 400m \geq 3400 & -\frac{3}{4}m + 8.5 \\ \hline 80m+50w \geq 680 & w = -\frac{8}{5}m + 13.6 \\ \hline \end{tabular}
